intro: Braya fengii, commonly known as the Feng's bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of western China. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to dry environments, with specialized structures that help it retain water. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Braya fengii is often found in rocky or sandy soils, growing in open, sun-exposed areas.
